task.title: Configuring Back-end Server Authentication
task.shortdesc: When running a web application with HTTPS or SSL as the backend server’s protocol, you might want to authenticate the back-end servers using the public key of the back-end server’s certificate. This authentication can be used to ensure that back-end servers accept only encrypted communication and to ensure that the back-end servers have the correct certificate.
